text:
Culture resort is located in a quiet corner of the road but it is still within a short walk from many restaurants and cafes and a beach. They have a couple of old bikes the guests can use to ride a bit further along the road for more restaurants and f. ex. turtle snorkeling facility. There is boat hiring, turtle snorkeling and surfing lessons provided nearby. There is plenty of restaurants along the road and they all have very good both local and European food, especially fresh from the ocean sea food!

10 minutes tuktuk ride west, there is Mirissa, a busy smaller town center and a tourist beaches with shops and different kinds of sightseeing trip providers. 10 minutes ride east there is Matara, a bigger town and a fort with some nice restaurants inside, and a temple. In Matara center there are banks and some bigger shops should you need them. 

Culture resort has got beautiful interiors decorated with a good taste, well sized rooms with big bathrooms and a middle size pool in the middle of the facility. There is just under 10 rooms altogether, so the hotel not too small but not too big either. Spacious outside lounge area is upstairs and breakfast is served there. We could choose from local or European breakfasts. That was delicious and with lots of fresh fruit! The hotel has a little restaurant attached to it were we could order some food, even things that weren‚Äôt on the menu! They also serve to the rooms with a little extra fee. The hotel helped us with getting tuktuks and drivers and the staff was always happy to help with whatever we needed. 

The sea view from our room was amazing and just outside the door was a nice area with lounge chairs and table. Some of the rooms have a balcony.

Everything was beautiful, clean and well maintained. Culture resort offers most of the facilities a bigger hotel would but they have a very nice homelike ambience of a smaller facility. 

We were so happy our family of three didn‚Äôt end up in the busy and a bit noisy Mirissa town as we originally planned but landed in this beautiful quiet place with everything we were looking for within short reach! We had a wonderful five days there! We can definitely recommend Culture resort to anyone!
title: Highly recommend!

text:
Wonderful hotel, not so far away from the heart of Mirissa (7-8min by tuktuk), on the beach, with amazing views.

The hotel is pretty small, probably a dozen rooms, very calm and perfect for quiet relaxation. We got a room on the second floor with stunning view to the beach, above the pool and with a spacious terrace. The room was huge, nicely designed, with space for everything, huge and super comfortable bed. 

Being positioned on the beach is amazing, you can long walks along it in silence and enjoying the vibes as the area is not for swimming. The pool is next to the beach, pool beds are just between the beach and the pool - simply perfect.

The restaurant is with open kitchen (that needs better air suction - the only minus of the hotel). Breakfast does not offer huge choice, but it was delicious.

Super friendly and helpful staff. We decided to stay one extra day - they helped us keep the same room and then on the last day allowed us to have a late check-out as we wanted to stay longer before going back to Colombo. This was true consumer-centricity! 

Hugely recommended!
title: Beautiful view, relaxing vibes, next to the beach, what else do you need?

text:
We had a very enjoyable 3  night stay at the Lantern towards the end of our 2 week trip to Sri Lanka. The hotel is very well kept and the staff were extremely helpful, especially Lakmal who gave us his WhatsApp number so that we could make requests or ask questions at any time. The rooms were spacious and the beds were very comfortable. We did not experience any issues with noise from the road - running the ceiling fan provided perfect white noise.
The pool was lovely (it was our favorite out of the 7 hotels we stayed at on our trip) and we enjoyed the meals we ate at the restaurant. The hotel is a 1000 rupee ride into "downtown" Mirissa, and the hotel staff were able to get tuk tuks very quickly.  We got to experience the baby turtle release which was super cool and several members of our party enjoyed a Balinese massage at the sister property just up the road,
The only downside is that the beach in this area is subject to strong waves and so wasn't really suitable for swimming while we were there. It's a gorgeous beach and it was too bad that no one could really use it. Perhaps the water is calmer at other times of the year. We went to Turtle Beach and Secret Beach to go swimming in the ocean.
title: Wonderful boutique hotel by the water

text:
I'm sitting here in suite 1 gazing over the meticulously landscaped grounds, inviting pool and breathtaking beach as I feel inspired to leave a review.

This is one of the most memorable and luxurious experiences we've ever enjoyed, anywhere in the world.

From the moment you're greeted by the excitable koi fish to the moment you realise you have more than enough plug sockets beside your bed. It's the small things that the  Reveal team and management has thought about, and executed with aplomb.

It's not just the small things though. The rooms themselves are effortlessly stylish, totally in character with the surroundings, and well-appointed.

The food - led by Chef Gamini - blew me away breakfast, lunch and dinner. 

The pool is inviting, glistens in the sun, and is equally well-designed as the rest of the property.

Some recognition for the grounds/gardening team who do a wonderful job, meticulously tending to the beautiful foliage around the place - some of the palm trees blow my mind.

You can walk to the brand's other properties, along the beach, or along the road, all within a 5-10 min walk - and you will be greeted with the same smile in all of them, with the team ready to take care of you, whichever property you're staying in.

This is an absolutely a fanatistic base for enjoying Mirissa, Polhena, and Weligama - the former two are within 5-10 minutes by Tuk Tuk.

A big thank you to Lakmal (what a star!), Ajith, Kavindu and Ashani. 

We absolutely cannot wait to return!

PS. Every now and again you can hear a vehicle passing by, but it is seldom, and was not an issue in the slightest (especially not at night) during the 5 nights we stayed.

Also, to address some other reviewer's comments; the dogs that you may come across on the beach (in fact, across all of Sri Lanka) are few in number, and in fact totally adorable. We spent a lot of time with them whenever we could - especially the puppies.
title: Our every checkbox, checked. And then some.

text:
My husband and I spent 3 nights at Lantern for our anniversary at the end of our 10-day tour. We had a beautiful room facing the ocean with a lovely balcony. It is a small 6 room property with a small but great little pool. They have an open kitchen, which gives it a really homely feel. The food is excellent, and Chef Dilruk ensures the quality and taste is to a high standard. We were on a half board basis, so dinner was a choice from a set menu. My husband is vegetarian, and Chef ensured he had a variety of dishes over the 3 days. They also arranged for me to have a little cooking lesson. Breakfast is plentiful and fresh, and I loved Chef's Sri Lankan take on the eggs benedict. The Managers are always at hand to ensure things are running smoothly a d make you feel at home. All the staff are wonderful and took great care of us. Akhtar especially ensured we were very well looked after.
The property is located on a quiet and gorgeous beach. Next door to the left, another hotel is being built, but it looks like it will be a similar sized property. Unfortunately, to the right a very big and totally not in keeping with the area, huge hotel is being built. The currents are strong so be extra cautious if swimming. The sand is soft and the water warm and the pool is perfect for a proper swim. The property is located close to Mirissa and a tuk tuk gets you there easily. We also visited coconut tree hill and had a very fun evening there sipping cocktails and watching whatever of the sunset as possible. The weather was temperamental and it was sunny  rainy, windy and cloudy intermittently. 
I highly recommend this property if you want to be directly on the beach in a quiet area with access to a busier town.
title: Three nights in Mirissa
